properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 11 at 4:44AM EST until February 11 at 9:15AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
* At 430 AM EST, widespread rainfall accumulations of 3-5 inches
on February 6th over the entire Catawba River watershed has caused
high flows and elevated lake levels along the Catawba River
reservoir chain. As the excess water is passed through each lake
project downstream, significant pool rises have occurred at the
middle Catawba River lakes, especially at Mountain Island Lake,
where the pool is above the full pool of 100.0 feet. This is
causing nuisance shoreline flooding and flooding of lake-access
areas, docks, and residential yards. As water spills over Mountain
Island Dam, high flows are also causing rises and nuisance flooding
of residential yards just downstream of the dam along the Catawba
River.

* Additional rainfall is expected tonight through Tuesday across the
Catawba River watershed.  Rainfall totals of up to an inch are
forecasted through Tuesday afternoon with additional rainfall
expected later this week.  The combined runoff from this rainfall
will result in additional flow that will need to be passed through
the Catawba reservoir system.  With the pool at Lake Norman near 99
feet, this additional water may require additional releases at
Cowans Ford Dam, which may result in additional rises and more
significant flooding at Mountain Island Lake and the Catawba River
immediately downstream of the dam.

* The following reservoir is experiencing Action/Advisory Stage
pool elevations:

Mountain Island Lake.
CURRENT Pool Elevation: 101.71 feet and rising slowly.

FORECAST: Duke Energy projects the pool may exceed 102 feet
Tuesday morning and potentially exceed 103.5 feet later this week if
the forecasted rainfall occurs.

ACTION/ADVISORY Stage: 101.5 feet.
MINOR Flood Stage: 103.0 feet.

IMPACTS: At 101.5 feet, Action/Advisory Stage. Nuisance flooding of
low-lying areas including residential yards, docks, and boat-launch
areas is ongoing.  Flooding of residential yards downstream of
Mountain Island Dam along Riverhaven Dr, Hart Rd, Lake Dr, and
Riverside Dr is beginning.

At 103.0 feet, Minor Flood Stage. Significant inundation of
low-lying areas is ongoing around Mountain Island Lake and downstream
of the dam along/near Riverside Dr. Some outbuilding inundation may
begin.

* Residents should take immediate actions to protect property
adjacent to Mountain Island Lake and the Catawba River, closely
monitor lake levels for sudden changes, and follow guidance from
Charlotte-Mecklenburg Emergency Management. Drivers are encouraged
to heed any barricades and avoid all flooded areas.

* For more information on lake levels or dam releases, people are
encouraged to visit http://lakes.duke-energy.com, call 1-800-829-
5253, or download the Duke Energy Lake View mobile app.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the
dangers of flooding.

If heavy rainfall causes additional gate releases upstream, the
Advisory may be upgraded to a Flash Flood Warning. People in
flood-prone areas, especially along the lakeshore and immediately
downstream of a dam, should prepare to move to higher ground quickly
if a Flash Flood Warning is issued.
